title: Low Ranking After 8/10 qualifiers won.
body:
Alright so i just recently finished my qualifiers and i'm wondering why i was placed so low in terms of ranking.
I won 8/10 of my qualifiers, yes some games my K/D/A wasn't so good but i did contribute a lot to the team winning those games at least in my opinion.
I play on OCE and i am just curious as to how i was played in bronze 4 after winning the amount of games that i did.
I am not expecting much of an answer, but i tried harder then ever this season and would just like an explanation.
Thank you for you time

replies.body:
1. K/D/A is irrelevant.
2. The order in which you win/lose games can affect where you are placed.
3. It is possible for your MMR to be an entire division below your rank before being demoted. *Note: check your estimated MMR on OP.GG*
4. It uses your rank from the end of season 4, not your rank from the end of pre-season. *Note that it still uses your MMR from the end of pre-season.*

You lost your chances in your first game. In the very first game of your promos I assume is the Vayne Game. You lost with a end game score of 6/13/8. You had a game MMR of 1130 and were placed with high bronze low silver. After that lose you've been placed with low bronze ever since. Your next Game MMR is 800. Which means you lost 300 in that one loss you had at the start. The order in which you lose and win your games is also a major factor to placements rather than just your win lose ratio. Sorry for your placements though. If you can continue playing like you appear to be. With the 8/2 win lose ratio I'm sure you'll make it out.

Regards,
Fog
Thanks very much, i will continue to try and get out of bronze it was just a massive bummer is all thank you for your time.
What was your rank last season ?
for some reason, a lot of people were placed really long. I know people that went like 6/4 and dropped from silver 4 to bronze 4.
I know it has something to do with the MMR system, but to my knowledge my MMR shouldn't be that bad?
